p: The discs (6 mm in diameter) impregnated with different concentrations (10, 20, 25, 30, 50 and 100 µg/mL) of the extract solution and deionized water (as negative control) were placed on the inoculated agar. The inoculated plates were incubated for 24 hr at 37 oC. Tetracycline (30µg/mL) was used as positive control. The diameters of inhibition zones were considered a measure of antimicrobial activity and each assay was repeated twice.
